Package cpsc2150.extendedConnectX.models

Interface IGameBoard

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbsGameBoard, GameBoard, GameBoardMem
    public interface IGameBoard
    Interface for our game board classes which contains default and primary methods
    Constraints:
    MINROWS <= [number of rows] <= MAXROWS AND MINCOLUMNS <= [number of columns] <= MAXCOLUMNS AND MINNUMTOWIN <= [number in a row to win] <= MAXNUMTOWIN AND MINPLAYERS <= [number of players] <= MAXPLAYERS

      static int MINCOLUMNS  
      static int MINNUMTOWIN  
      static int MINPLAYERS  
      static int MINROWS

      default boolean checkDiagWin​(BoardPosition pos, char p)

    • Method Detail

      • getNumRows

        int getNumRows()
        This method will get the number of rows in the gameboard
        Returns:
        The number of rows in the gameboard
        Post:
        getNumRows() = MAXROWS

      • getNumColumns

        int getNumColumns()
        This method will get the number of columns in the gameboard
        Returns:
        The number of columns in the gameboard
        Post:
        getNumColumns() = MAXCOLUMNS

      • getNumToWin

        int getNumToWin()
        This method will get the number of consecutive tokens in a row that are needed to win
        Returns:
        An integer stating the number of consecutive tokens needed in a row to win the game
        Post:
        getNumToWin() = NUMTOWIN

      • placeToken

        void placeToken​(char p,
                int c)
        This method will allow the user to place marker p in column c in the lowest available row
        Parameters:
        p - this is the type of marker the user will be placing
        c - this is the column number the user will place their marker in
        Pre:
        checkIfFree(c) = true AND 0 <= c < MAXCOLUMNS
        Post:
        iff [column c has empty spaces then the marker will be placed in lowest row number that is a blank space]

      • whatsAtPos

        char whatsAtPos​(BoardPosition pos)
        This function returns what is in the gameboard at a certain position
        Parameters:
        pos - This is the game board position that is being checked
        Returns:
        ['X' if X is at the position, 'O' if O is at the position, OR " " if the position is blank]
        Pre:
        0 <= pos.getRow() < MAXROWS AND 0 <= pos.getColumn() <= MAXCOLUMNS
        Post:
        [returns the content at pos which either is an empty space, or one of the markers] AND self = #self

      • checkTie

        default boolean checkTie()
        This function will check to see if the game has resulted in a tie
        Returns:
        [true if none of the positions in the game board are empty]
        Pre:
        [Neither player has been declared the winner yet]
        Post:
        [If the game results in a tie, the game will be over, if there is no tie the game will continue] AND self = #self

      • checkIfFree

        default boolean checkIfFree​(int c)
        returns true if column c can accept another token
        Parameters:
        c - number of column that will be checked
        Returns:
        true if the column is not full, false if the column is full
        Pre:
        0 <= c < getNumColumns()
        Post:
        [if true then column can accept another token] AND self = #self

      • checkForWin

        default boolean checkForWin​(int c)
        returns true if last token placed in column c results in a win
        Parameters:
        c - column number that will be checked
        Returns:
        true iff [checkHorizWin() OR checkVertWin() OR checkDiagWin() are true and first index of the column is not empty]
        Pre:
        0 <= c < getNumColumns()
        Post:
        [if true game will be ended and current player will be named the winner, if false game will continue] AND self = #self

      • isPlayerAtPos

        default boolean isPlayerAtPos​(BoardPosition pos,
                              char player)
        This function will check to see if the player is at the position
        Parameters:
        pos - The board position that will be checked
        player - The marker that will be checked
        Returns:
        [True if player has their marker at the position that is being checked False if player does not have their marker at the position that is being checked]
        Pre:
        0 <= pos.getRow() < MAXROWS AND 0 <= pos.getColumn() <= MAXCOLUMNS
        Post:
        [will return true if the player is present in the game board at position pos] AND self = #self

      • checkHorizWin

        default boolean checkHorizWin​(BoardPosition pos,
                              char p)
        This function checks to see if the last marker placed resulted in winning in a row horizontally
        Parameters:
        pos - This is the board position the player placed their token at
        p - This is the type of marker that was placed
        Returns:
        [True if there are NUMTOWIN tokens in a row horizontally, false if there are not]
        Pre:
        0 <= pos.getRow() < MAXROWS AND 0 <= pos.getColumn() < MAXCOLUMNS AND [pos is the location the last marker was placed]
        Post:
        [returns true if placed marker is the last to make up NUMTOWIN number of consecutive markers needed to win horizontally] AND self = #self

      • checkVertWin

        default boolean checkVertWin​(BoardPosition pos,
                             char p)
        This function checks to see if the last token placed resulted in getNumToWin() in a row vertically
        Parameters:
        pos - This is the board position the player placed their marker at
        p - This is the type of marker that was placed
        Returns:
        [True if there are getNumToWin() tokens in a row vertically, false if there is not]
        Pre:
        0 <= pos.getRow() < MAXROWS AND 0 <= pos.getColumn() < MAXCOLUMNS AND [pos is the location the last marker was placed]
        Post:
        [returns true if placed marker is the last to make up getNumToWin() number of consecutive markers needed to win vertically] AND self = #self

      • checkDiagWin

        default boolean checkDiagWin​(BoardPosition pos,
                             char p)
        This function checks to see if the last token placed resulted in getNumToWin() in a row diagonally
        Parameters:
        pos - This is the board position the player placed their marker at
        p - This is the type of marker that was placed
        Returns:
        [True if there are getNumToWin tokens in a row diagonally, false if there is not]
        Pre:
        0 <= pos.getRow() < MAXROWS AND 0 <= pos.getColumn() < MAXCOLUMNS AND [pos is the location the last marker was placed]
        Post:
        [returns true if placed marker is the last to make up getNumToWin() number of consecutive markers needed to win diagonally] AND self = #self
